text: Go on then, ask your questions!
Uh... So you are a drummer? Sorry, that wasn't really a question..
Yes, I am a drummer. What of it?
How... did you get into it?
Ahh, excellent question. You see, I used to be a taiko drummer for the yakuza...
Life was... chaotic, loud, violent and I was full of anger. One day my nerves got the better of me and I failed to the play the bosses favorite song correctly. So I was banished.
What does a banish yakuza drummer even do after that?
*Is this really a conversation that I am having or did I pass out again*
Well, I was never able to get the sound of my mistake out of my head. So one day I decided to punish myself by sitting underneath a powerful waterfall...
*Doesn't he realize that its much easier to beat yourself up in your head?*
I found myself struggling to breath as the cold deluge of water cascaded over me. Something about it-the way I was forced to focus on my breathing-it washed away all the noise from my head.
From then on, drumming was different. It became a way of finding peace.
Thank you. Drumming's more than beating a drum. Its about finding a rhythm that calms-or ignites-your spirit. That is what my music means to me.
*He's right... Maybe music can help me find peace, too.*
